page.title: 15THE PRIORY WATERFOWL FARM
page.content: This was established in 1928 by Reginald Appleyard.It was bought by Lt.Col.A.A.Johnson in 1947,who continued to run the business until he retired in 1970. The priory farm consists of 30 acres of grassland,river streams and pools.The farm is managed by Mr.J.Copsey and produces ornamental waterfowl poultry and pheasants. There are 4 types of swans,24 of geese,64 of ducks,10 of domestic geese & ducks,18 of poultry,16 of ornamental pheasants and 3 of peafowl.They also sell St.Kilda Sheep at 30 pounds each. The most expensive is a pair of Bufflehead at 400 pounds and the cheapest is a pair of Broody-Type Bantams at 2.50 pounds.There are a total of 2000 birds on the farm. In 1930 & 1932 Appleyard won the British Dairy Farmers' Association Championship medal for best Gander or Goose.
